meanings.definition: A tall, slender tower typically part of a mosque, with a balcony from which a muezzin calls Muslims to prayer.
meanings.sent1: The minarets of the mosque reached high into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The minarets of the mosque were beautifully adorned with intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The minarets of the mosque seemed to whisper ancient tales to the wind.
meanings.sent4: The minarets of the mosque stood like guardians watching over the city.
meanings.sent5: The minarets of the mosque gleamed in the sunlight, a beacon of faith.

meanings.definition: A tall, slender tower or turret attached to a building.
meanings.sent1: The old castle had minarets that added to its grandeur.
meanings.sent2: The minarets of the mansion gave it a regal appearance.
meanings.sent3: The minarets of the building looked like they were reaching for the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The minarets of the tower stood out against the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The minarets of the structure were a symbol of architectural elegance.
